newsitem.title: CHINA: Japan's Iris Ohyama sets up $40 mln China unit.
newsitem.headline: Japan's Iris Ohyama sets up $40 mln China unit.

text.p: Japan's Iris Ohyama Inc, a major plastics producer, has set up a wholly owned subsidiary in Dalian in northeastern China's Liaoning province, an official of the new company said on Thursday.
The company invested $40 million in Dalian Iris Ohyama Industry and Trade Co Ltd, which is based in the city's free trade zone, the official said by telephone from Dalian.
The firm will produce plastic products and office equipment, with all products to be exported to the United States, Japan and South Korea, he said.
The official gave no further details.
